metadata.title: CVE-2022-41721 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: A request smuggling attack is possible when using MaxBytesHandler. Whenusing MaxBytesHandler, the body of an HTTP request is not fully consumed.When the server attempts to read HTTP2 frames from the connection, it willinstead be reading the body of the HTTP request, which could beattacker-manipulated to represent arbitrary HTTP2 requests.

criterions.comment: google-guest-agent: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
